net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.refractor

Class CustomStringLens

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.refractor.Lens<java.lang.String>
      • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.refractor.CustomStringLens
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Refractor<java.lang.String>

    public class CustomStringLens
extends Lens<java.lang.String>
implements Refractor<java.lang.String>
    An entirely silly implementation of a string lens, which substitutes the word "Sparkles" for any value. Used solely for testing, including CustomLensTest.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.5 (#41)

      • getSQLiteDefaultValue

        public java.lang.String getSQLiteDefaultValue()
        Description copied from interface: Refractor
        Returns a reasonable non-null default value for a column of this data type in SQLite, particularly for cases in which the value cannot be null. Examples would be 0 for integer types, an empty string for string types, false for Boolean types, etc.
        Specified by:
